title: As Europe's Meat Consumption Drops, Burger King Puts Plants to the Test - VegNews
summary: Burger King in the UK is aiming to serve a menu that is 50 percent plant-based by 2030, responding to consumer demand for plant-based options. They have launched a campaign challenging perceptions about plant-based foods and offering promotions to encourage customers to try their plant-based options. This aligns with broader trends of declining meat consumption in the UK and Germany, with more people choosing plant-based alternatives for various reasons.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is green innovation as Burger King's initiative to introduce more plant-based options to their menu aligns with sustainability goals and addresses environmental impacts of meat consumption.
business_innovation: FALSE. While Burger King's introduction of plant-based options can be seen as a form of innovation within their business model, it does not significantly differ from their previous products or processes as defined in business innovation.
green_product: TRUE. Burger King's plant-based menu items like the Vegan Royale and Plant-Based Whopper are designed and manufactured to significantly reduce the environmental impact throughout their lifecycle, aligning with the definition of a green product.
green_process: FALSE. The article focuses more on the introduction of green products (plant-based menu items) rather than specific processes within Burger King's operations, so it does not fully discuss green processes.
